item.title: Cyberpunk 2077 On Nintendo Switch 2 Runs At 40 FPS, Costs $70
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/cyberpunk-2077-on-nintendo-switch-2-runs-at-40-fps-costs-70/

When the Nintendo Switch 2 was fully revealed on April 2, one of the bigger third-party game announcements came when CD Projekt Red confirmed that Cyberpunk 2077 would be launching on the console. Now, just a day later, there are more details on what Switch 2 players can expect from the game on the new system.

According to the studio’s vice president of business development Jan Rosner, Cyberpunk 2077: Ultimate Edition will cost $70 when it releases on June 5. What’s more is that, should you buy the physical version of the game, it will come full on the Switch 2 cartridge.

“The game will be distributed on a 64GB game card (containing the game and expansion, no download required), as well as via digital download from Nintendo eShop for Nintendo Switch 2,” Rosner said.

The news of the game being included on the physical card comes after Nintendo revealed that not all physical copies of games for the system will actually include the games themselves. Instead, they will be treated as licensing keys that allow you to download and play the game on your console.

With the game being on the Switch 2, many have wondered how the game’s performance would be. Bloomberg’s Jason Schreier, who spent time with the game on the system, gave a bit of insight on that front.

In a post on social media, Schreier says that Cyberpunk 2077 ran at 40fps while in performance mode when the system was docked. He didn’t mention how the game runs in handheld.

Insider Gaming has reached out to CD Projekt Red for more details on the game’s performance on the console. Should a response be received, it will be added to this article.

item.title: Emma Frost Leak Suggests Marvel Rivals Season 2 Debut Awaits
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/emma-frost-leaks-suggests-marvel-rivals-season-2-debut-awaits/

Marvel Rivals players might need to wrap up warm as a leak says Emma Frost is dropping into the Season 2 action. The feisty female has been a mainstay in Marvel comics for years, and a Rivals appearance is fitting.

NetEase did the unthinkable and broke into the live-service shooter market. The hero-based multiplayer title has managed to keep up with its contemporaries and remain one of the most-played online games on the market. The Season 1 Eternal Night Falls content is symptomatic of the game’s success, offering plenty of exciting new additions.

But live-service titles need to evolve and expand—it can’t all be about twerking Venom emotes. Marvel Rivals Season 2 continues this heroic origin story, and a leaker has outed Emma Frost as an integral piece of the next chapter.

Marvel Rivals Season 2 Debut For Emma Frost Reported

It’s unlikely many players would be cold toward an Emma Frost arrival. The femme fatale has been a favorite throughout the comics and has regularly been seen across various forms of Marvel media. According to leaker XOXLEAK, she’s destined to make her Marvel Rivals bow in Season 2.

The user posted an image on X showing (presumably) a snippet of the Marvel Rivals Season 2 artwork. You can see a character model that looks the spitting image of Emma Frost in it.

From the white and icy blue outfit to the ice crystals protruding from the getup, I think I can say with confidence this is Emma Frost.

Emma Frost arrives in season 2

If it is her and this post is real, it’s unclear if Emma Frost arrives on day one or is a later inclusion. Either way, it’s another solid acquisition for a stacked Marvel Rivals roster.

item.title: Change Made To Madden 26 Broadcast Team
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/change-made-to-madden-26-broadcast-team/

When players load up EA Sports Madden NFL 26 this year, they’re going to notice a change to the game’s broadcast team. Specifically, there will be something different about the game’s in-game voice.

According to Jordan Schultz of Fox Sports, the voice of NFL RedZone Scott Hanson is joining the series as the new in-game host for Madden 26. Hanson is expected to replace Johnathan Coachman who had long-been the in-game host of the game.

READ MORE: Latest Game Announcements – April 3, 2025

While know specifics weren’t revealed, Hanson is likely to be the voice players here when loading into a game as well as during halftime. It’s unknown if more will be added for Hanson’s role as EA Sports has yet to officially reveal Madden 26’s features.

Madden 26 is expected to be revealed sometime in late spring/early summer ahead of a summer release. For Madden 25, the first reveal came in June when the game’s cover athlete was announced. It could be assumed that EA will likely stay on the same schedule for this year’s game as well.

Sticking with Madden news, it was confirmed during April 2’s Nintendo Switch 2 Direct that the franchise will be returning to Nintendo consoles for the first time in over a decade. Madden 26, along with EA Sports FC, will be launching later this year for the Nintendo Switch 2 console.

According to EA, both titles will have feature parity to other platforms “as much as the hardware allows.”

item.title: All Nintendo Switch 2 Launch Titles—Every Switch 2 Exclusive Revealed
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/all-nintendo-switch-2-release-titles/

Exciting launch titles are a big reason to get a Switch 2 on day one. The Nintendo Switch 2 already has a fair few big-name games ready for the Switch 2 release, and I know you’re also here to see what exclusives the Japanese game company has up its sleeves.

A new console generation hinges on several variables: Its price, the features and specs, and software. The Nintendo Switch 2 Direct finally revealed much of this and gave people reasons to buy the new console. You want better graphics? The new 4K, HDR, and 120 FPS upgrades will do this. Want to revisit your favorite GameCube games in 2025? Say hello to the GameCube Switch Online integration.

But it’s new games that sell consoles, let’s face it. So let’s see which Nintendo Switch 2 games are currently releasing for launch.

Every Nintendo Switch 2 Launch Game

By “launch,” we quite literally mean playable games the second the Nintendo Switch 2 release date is hit. A handful of titles are scheduled for July and beyond, but they’re not what we’re looking for today.

Here’s every game you can look forward to if you pre-order your Nintendo Switch 2 to be ready on day one:

  • Arcade Archives 2 RIDGE RACER
  • Borderlands 4
  • Bravely Default
  • Civilization 7
  • Cyberpunk 2077: Ultimate Edition
  • Deltarune
  • Drag x Drive
  • EA Sports FC
  • Fast Fusion
  • Fortnite
  • Hitman: World of Assassination
  • Hogwarts Legacy
  • Human Fall Flat 2
  • Kunitsu-Gami: Path of the Goddess
  • Madden NFL
  • Mario Kart World
  • Nobunaga’s Ambition: Awakening Complete Edition
  • Puyo Puyo Tetris 2S
  • Rune Factory: Guardians of Azuma
  • Street Fighter 6
  • Split Fiction
  • Survival Kids
  • Yakuza 0: Director’s Cut

We have an extended list of all games announced for the Switch 2 as well. The console’s first year should be a meaty one with lots of gaming to be done.

All Nintendo Switch 2 Exclusive Games

The Nintendo Switch 2 exclusive list is much shorter but expected to grow. It includes some of Nintendo’s most iconic franchises (as expected), and the future looks rosier than a shy-looking Kirby.

There are plenty of other Nintendo games arriving in 2025, from Metroid Prime 4 to Pokémon Legends Z-A, but these can also be found on the Nintendo Switch 1.

We’re looking at the sole reasons to invest in the Nintendo Switch 2, so check out the exclusive list so far.

What do you think of the Switch 2 lineup? Do any particular games catch your eye? Let us know which games you’re hoping are announced soon via our Insider Gaming Forum.
